• A few years ago, Georgia Gwinnett college was home to just over 100 students.

 • Now it has more than 9000 students.

 • Gwinnett County was the largest county east of the Mississippi without a four-year college.

 • GGC opened its doors in 2006 as the first four-year college founded in Georgia in more than 100 years, and the first four-year, public college created in the U.S. in the 21st century.

 • Georgia Gwinnett College is a member of the University System of Georgia.

 • Gwinnett County remains one of the most dynamic regions in the South to live and work with a current population of 824,941, and a population of 1.2 million projected by the year 2025.

 • GGC will be a wellspring of educational innovation

 • The 90,000 square-foot Library has a capacity for 300,000 volumes.

 • GGC students place the college among the top 10% of colleges nationwide for the level of academic challenge according to the National Survey of Student Engagement 2011.

 • GGC offers 12 majors - biology, business administration, criminal justice/criminology, early childhood education, English, exercise science, history, information technology, mathematics, political science, psychology and special education.

 • There are more than 40 concentrations, seven academic minors, a certificate in Latin-American Studies and an Honors Program.

 • Our ROTC program offers students from all academic majors a unique pathway into a post-graduate career as a military officer.

 • The Library has a gold-level certification from the U.S. Green Building Council’s Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED) program.

 • The Library promotes the whole-building approach to sustainability by recognizing performance in six key areas of human and environmental health.

 • GGC's Library is the first academic library in Georgia to achieve LEED Gold certification.
